title: Windows Vista Gamers Edition x64 Unattended
description:
Windows Vista Gamers Edition x64 Unattended (by Old.Bombadillo)



Very simple, vLited Vista Ultimate x64, Unattended Install, skipped product key, 

skipped auto activation. NOTHING added NOTHING taken away besides what is allowed

within vLite.



With my limited knowledge I opened vLite and looked at the settings from this Vista 

installation:
 <a href="
http://thepiratebay.se/tor/4019916/Vista_Gamers_Edition_(by_megaposter)" rel="nofollow" target="_NEW">
http://thepiratebay.se/tor/4019916/Vista_Gamers_Edition_(by_megaposter)</a>

I wrote down all settings and duplicated them with a Vista Ultimate x64 setup.
   (a x32 is on it&#039;s way)

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Here is essentially what this Vista install contains.

Components:

  -Accessories
Paint
System Information
Wordpad

  -Drivers
Ethernet Network Adapters
Qlogic Fibre Channel Adapter
Sound Controllers

  -Hardware Support
Dynamic Volume Manager
Modem Support

  -Multimedia
Sample Pictures

  -Network
Internet Explorer
Remote Desktop Client

  -Services
Multimedia Class Scheduler
Offline Files

  -System
Microsoft HTML engine
Performance Counters
ReadyBoost
Remote Differential Compression

DEP Disabled (AlwaysOff)
UAC OFF

Hibernation Off
Paging Exec Enabled
Power settg High Performance

Show exts. for know file types  Yes
Show hidden files and folders   Yes
Show protected OS system files  Yes


NO AERO THEME, WINDOWS CLASSIC FTW!

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------




I had trouble with megaposters Vista installing any updates, particularly KB940105 

(Virtual Address Memory hotfix) which fixes Crysis from randomly quitting to the 

desktop for me.


This version CAN INSTALL UPDATES via Windows Update OR .msu&#039;s, .exe&#039;s etc.


I have also integrated all hotfixes suggested on Nvidias website:
 <a href="
http://www.nvidia.com/object/windows_vista_hotfixes.html" rel="nofollow" target="_NEW">
http://www.nvidia.com/object/windows_vista_hotfixes.html</a>



ATI users can uninstall KB945149 if they have problems, all other hotfixes are also 

listed on ATI&#039;s site.



If you know of any other updates that would specifically help this GAMING version 

of Vista, plz post and I will integrate with a later version (probably when SP1 

comes out, as i will create an integrated release then) Also if you know any safe 

tweaks, registry edits, general tips, ANYTHING that would aid FPS and game

performance PLEASE FEEL FREE TO POST!!! Any way I can make this simple release 

better too, constructive criticism always welcome!

This Vista uses appx. half (less even!) the RAM of regular Vista Ultimate x64
